    • Constructor Detail

      • EventListener

        public EventListener(EmulationController emualtionController)

    • Method Detail

      • clearReactions

        public void clearReactions()
        This is used to reset the reactions that are loaded into the EventListener. This will happen every time the ControllerState has been changed in the ControllerStateMachine.

      • loadReactions

        public void loadReactions(java.lang.String gestureId,
                          java.util.List<Reaction> reactions)
        This is for loading the valid reactions for the current ControllerState's gestures. This will happen every time the ControllerState has been changed in the ControllerStateMachine.
        Parameters:
        gestureId - The given reactions belong to the gesture identified by this id.
        reactions - These are the reactions that belong to some gesture. When the gesture is matched by Esper, then these reactions will be looked up and triggered.

      • loadPersistentReactions

        public void loadPersistentReactions(java.lang.String gestureId,
                                    java.util.List<PersistentReaction> reactions)
        This is for loading the valid persistent reactions for the current ControllerState's gestures. This will happen every time the ControllerState has been changed in the ControllerStateMachine.
        Parameters:
        gestureId - The given reactions belong to the gesture identified by this id.
        reactions - These are the reactions that belong to some gesture. When the gesture is matched by Esper, then these reactions will be looked up and triggered.

      • update

        public void update(com.espertech.esper.client.EventBean[] newEvents,
                   com.espertech.esper.client.EventBean[] oldEvents)
        Esper uses this method to inform the EventListener when a gesture has been matched.
        Specified by:
        update in interface com.espertech.esper.client.UpdateListener
        Parameters:
        newEvents - When a gesture's pattern is matched, Esper sends this method a newEvent.
        oldEvents - The previous newEvents that have already been processed.
